title: Computer Vision
content:
Core Tasks

  • Classification: Image categorization (assigning labels to entire images)
  • Detection: Locating and identifying objects in images (bounding boxes)
  • Segmentation: Pixel-level classification (semantic, instance, panoptic)
  • Generation: Creating new visual content (GANs, diffusion models)
  • Pose Estimation: Determining position and orientation of objects
  • Optical Flow: Tracking motion between frames

Deep Learning Approaches

  • Convolutional Networks: CNN architectures (AlexNet, VGG, ResNet, Inception)
  • Vision Transformers: Attention-based image processing (ViT, Swin Transformer)
  • Generative Models: GANs, VAEs, diffusion models (DALL-E, Stable Diffusion)
  • Self-supervised Learning: Contrastive methods, masked image modeling
  • Multi-modal Learning: CLIP, image-text alignment

Course Topics (CSCI-GA.2271-001)

  • Image Formation: Cameras, lenses, perspective projection, color theory
  • Feature Detection: SIFT, Harris corner detector, scale-space theory
  • Image Matching: Descriptors, RANSAC, homography estimation
  • 3D Vision: Epipolar geometry, stereo matching, structure from motion
  • Neural Networks: Backpropagation, optimization methods, regularization
  • Applications: Face recognition, autonomous vehicles, medical imaging, AR/VR

Recent Advances

  • Foundation Models: Large-scale pre-trained vision models
  • Zero/Few-shot Learning: Adapting to new tasks with minimal examples
  • Neurosymbolic Methods: Combining neural nets with symbolic reasoning
  • Efficient Architectures: MobileNet, EfficientNet for resource-constrained devices
